• The inventive MRI apparatus determines the required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and stores them until the conclusion of the examination.
• The adjustment parameters include the position of the support plate, the configuration of the transmit and receive coils, and corresponding control signals.
• The apparatus has a support plate that can be displaced longitudinally, allowing for the examination of larger body sections.
• The transmit and receive coils can be connected or disconnected in a desired configuration, and the adjustment parameters are stored in a memory until the conclusion of the examination.
• The inventive apparatus allows for high-contrast exposures without omitting adjustments, resulting in reduced examination times.
• The apparatus is suitable for various forms of MRI apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets, and can be used for examinations such as tracking doses of contrast agent over a larger body region.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a fastener system for albums, such as photographic albums and scrapbooks, that allows for easy addition or replacement of album pages.
• The fastener system consists of a pair of strap anchors, one attached to the front cover and the other to the back cover, and a strap that passes through aligned apertures in the covers and album pages.
• The strap anchors are in the form of channels with snap-lock mechanisms that allow the strap to be easily inserted and removed.
• The strap has parallel ribs that engage with the ribs on the base of the channel to prevent longitudinal movement and provide a secure locking effect.
• The fastener system allows for adjustment of the effective length of the strap to accommodate a variable thickness of the album, making it easier to add or replace pages.
• The invention provides a simple and cost-effective solution for album fasteners, with a low profile design that does not interfere with closure of the cover.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a new sulky construction that can be manufactured using light metal and other lightweight materials, providing a stable and durable design.
• The sulky has a unique design where the shafts are fastened to the frame in the planes of the wheels, allowing for a stable construction and easy assembly.
• The sulky is designed to be assembled easily by the user themselves, using ordinary hand tools, and the connections are secure without any play.
• The sulky has a weight reduction of approximately 40% compared to traditional sulkies, with a total weight of around 18 kg in a ready-to-use state.
• The sulky is designed to be packed into a flat box for storing and transportation, and the user can assemble the parts themselves in a quarter of an hour.
• The sulky has a stable and reliable construction, with a design that allows for easy introduction of the extruded profile in the mounting bushing, and the use of strengthening elements to ensure a close and durable connection.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly useful in connection with water-cooled generators.
* Prior to operation, special attention must be paid to eliminate air enclosed in the cooling system to avoid local overheating.
* Air bubbles accumulating in the circuit can reduce the efficiency of the cooling system, but are often ignored in prior art techniques.
* The invention aims to provide an arrangement that automatically removes or reduces air bubbles in rotating pipes.
* The ventilation system includes at least one bypass with an inlet and an outlet arranged between the feed and discharge ducts of the apparatus.
* The bypass has an inlet that opens into the space around the axis of rotation, where air bubbles accumulate due to the lowest pressure point.
* The invention provides a simple and effective ventilation system that can be designed in various forms, including a T-pipe, a radially arranged pipe, and a coiled pipe.
* The bypass can be arranged at any desired point of the inner pipe, and can be designed to increase hydrodynamic resistance to minimize bypass flow.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle that comprises a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft rotatably about its longitudinal axis and a retaining part, which the jacket unit is secured non-displaceably up to a limit value of a force acting onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.

• The jacket unit is connected with the retaining part across an energy absorption connection, which comprises at least one bending wire or strip that, upon a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part parallel to the longitudinal direction toward the motor vehicle front, is deformed.

• The invention aims to decrease the force peak (=break-away peak) that occurs during the opening of the break-away connection in the event of a crash.

• According to the invention, an elastic prestress is exerted onto the at least one bending wire or strip, which decreases the force required to release the break-away connection in the event of a crash.

• The jacket unit is prestressed with respect to the retaining part in the displacement direction parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the vehicle front.

• The force peak during the breaking away of the jacket unit from the retaining part (=break-away peak) can thereby be decreased or entirely avoided.

• The steering column is preferably implemented such that it is adjustable in length, with an openable and closable securement device that applies a securement force for the securement of the jacket unit with respect to the bracket unit against a displacement parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.

• The retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device, which is in engagement with a securement part that is secured in position with respect to the bracket unit such that it is nondisplaceable in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.

• The energy absorption device for enabling the energy absorbing dislocation of the jacket unit in the event of a crash is integrated into the securement device.

• The invention has an advantageous effect on the noise behavior of the steering column, with a dampening effect achieved through the prestress of the bending wire or strip.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method for mounting flat, uncurved glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles, eliminating the need for expensive pre-contoured and pre-stressed glass panels.
* The conventional process of installing curved glass panels involves tempering and contouring the glass, which can cause it to become less flexible and more brittle, and can lead to problems with packaging and transportation.
* The present invention uses a flat glass panel that is flexed in situ to conform to the curved window bay, and is then held in place by a combination of resilient clips and a reveal molding.
* The reveal molding is provided with a triangular-shaped head that snaps onto the clips, and is biased to urge the molding inwardly and downwardly into the window bay, where it presses onto the face of the glass panel and maintains its flexure.
* A continuous bead of adhesive sealant is applied to the edge of the glass panel, and is allowed to cure until the panel becomes fixed permanently in the window opening.
* The present invention provides a cost-effective and efficient method for installing curved glass windows in vehicles, and eliminates the need for expensive pre-contoured and pre-stressed glass panels.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention describes a method and apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, particularly for separating oxygen from water on an offshore hydrocarbon recovery platform. The apparatus includes a vessel with multiple gasification chambers, each with a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid to displace the first gas.
* The second gas, such as nitrogen, is introduced into the liquid through the mechanisms, creating a turbulent area and allowing the second gas to physically displace the first gas, which is then removed through a tank breather. The apparatus can be used to reduce the concentration of the first gas in the liquid to desired levels, and can be controlled by a programmable logic controller and level transmitters.
</summary>

<summary>
• The packaging machine according to the present disclosure is provided with a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction of the packaging machine, which drives the tool members of a plurality of work stations, thus synchronizing their movements mechanically.
• The transfer mechanism, which converts the rotational movement of the shaft into the movement required to operate the respective tool member, can be an arrangement of toggle levers and/or a cam mechanism, and may include a wear-reducing element to reduce wear-dependent load on the transfer mechanism and the shaft.
• The packaging machine can be modified in various respects, including providing further work stations, driving further tool members of the existing work stations by means of the common shaft, and implementing a transfer mechanism that converts the rotary movement of the shaft into a linear movement.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a disposable finishing article drive member assembly that securely holds the article during operation, is light in weight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles.
• The assembly includes a backing flange with gripping means, a retaining nut, and a pressure cap that snap into place without the use of adhesives.
• The backing flange is snugly received on the back surface of the grinding wheel and defines a central aperture aligned with the aperture in the grinding wheel.
• The retaining nut is inserted through the apertures in the wheel and flange and has a protrusion that extends outwardly to secure the nut and flange together.
• The pressure cap is snapped into locking engagement with the hub assembly and includes a gripping rib that snaps over the fingers on the backing flange.
• The assembly requires no additional clamping force during rotation of the wheel, and the grinding wheel is precluded from movement relative to the hub or driving member.
• The invention can accommodate all currently known sizes of standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels and meets all safety standards currently known and in existence.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention is based on a generic hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system, which includes a housing block, a motor, and a covering hood.
• The hydraulic unit has a cam element chamber, where pressure fluid entrained by a piston pump is delivered to the spring chamber, far from electrical components.
• The invention yields cost savings and a hermetic seal of the unit from the environment, allowing the housing block to be immersed and submerged without risk of damage.
• The housing block can be produced economically with fewer conduits and easier cleaning.
• A housing block known from EP 0 699 571 A1 can be used without changing its size or basic internal design.
• The engineer can decide how much pressure fluid entrained by the piston should be stored, depending on the intended use of the hydraulic unit.
• The invention provides a practical exemplary embodiment for containers with recourse to deep-drawing techniques known per se.
• The invasion of water between a fastening portion of the container and the housing block is averted, making production favorable from a production standpoint.
• The motor can be delivered complete to an assembly line, and an intended sealing off against the invasion of water from the environment into the motor and cam element chamber is avoided.
• The invention provides a pressure equilibrium between the motor and the covering hood, protecting electromagnets of valves of the hydraulic unit from the harmful effects of the environment.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to power and free conveyor systems, specifically to the transfer of carriers from one predetermined path to another.
* The system includes a third dog that is normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but is held by the track out of operative position.
* The second and third dogs include cam projections that engage portions of the track to hold them out of operative position, and as the carrier moves to a transfer zone, one or the other of the second and third dogs is successively moved to operative position.
* The system allows for selective transfer of the carrier across short or long distances, accommodating various systems where the transfer varies between short and long distances.
* The system can be operated by moving the dogs upwardly simultaneously or sequentially, and can be modified to minimize the number of pushers on the conveyor chain.
* The system can also be used in different configurations, such as in a track configuration where the carriers and chains move in the opposite direction, or in a system where the carrier is moved from one path toward the other and then is pushed through the transfer area to the second.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners, which provides effective grounding without the use of conductive plates, clips, or shunts attached to the liner.
• The liner material used in the invention has similar mechanical properties to the liner disclosed in Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951, but has improved electrical properties.
• The liner is composed of a base ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive, such as 2% carbon black.
• The conductive material is added to the UHMW-PE in particulate or powder form and then the mixture is heated under mold pressure for thermoforming.
• The liner has a high degree of elastic memory and is free from distending or stretching characteristics, making it suitable for withstanding loads imposed by cars.
• The liner is designed to fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, limiting lost motion movement of the center plate relative to the bowl.
• The liner provides two slip surfaces with the center plate assembly to ensure the needed swiveling action of the car trucks with respect to the car body.
• The liner meets the electrical conductivity standards of 1×10^5 ohms (100 Kohms) and has a coefficient of friction similar to the all UHMW-PE liner, making it an improvement over both the all UHMW-PE liner and the clip or shunt grounded version.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a gate valve used for controlling the bulk dispensing of viscous substances, such as sauces and salad dressings, from flexible bags or pouches.
• The valve is designed to be operated with one hand, allowing the other hand to hold a receiving vessel, and can be used in fast-food restaurants and other settings.
• The valve assembly consists of a spout insert mounting sleeve, a gate valve guide member, and a gate valve member, which work together to control the flow of the substance.
• The gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member by means of an integral upward guide and operating channel-like extension, which allows it to be moved between opened and closed positions.
• The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily, and can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position, making it suitable for use in dispensers.
• The valve can be actuated with one hand only, and provides a gradual or quick transition from opened to closed positions, with complete cut-off occurring when the valve reaches closed position.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a vehicular rearview mirror system that can be used with various types of vehicles with modifications to the circuit, and is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control.
* The system includes a variable reflective element that assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal, and a mirror control that is responsive to the output of the vehicle control for generating at least one mirror control output.
* The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control by monitoring the output of the vehicle control in attempting to conclude a state of the output of the vehicle control.
* The system may include a microcomputer having software and the microcomputer determines the protocol by software processing.
* The microcomputer may monitor the output of the vehicle control upon starting of the vehicle and/or upon running of the vehicle.
* The system may include at least one light sensor and the mirror control may establish a value for the drive signal in response to an output of the at least one light sensor.
* The invention uses a software-based protocol determining technique that utilizes a logical sequence of events to determine the protocol of an output of the vehicle control.
* The technique adjusts the value of a running average parameter as the vehicle is operated, and updates the protocol for the output of the vehicle control when the value of the running average reaches an extremely high or an extremely low value.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is directed to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles that employs an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension to prevent the front fork from diving during braking.
* The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and can be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel.
* The anti-dive unit is provided on the front wheel-supporting front fork and controls the contracting action of the telescopic front fork in accordance with an operation of the front wheel brake, suppressing the contracting action of the front fork to quickly increase the grounding load on the front wheel.
* The anti-dive unit can be of a braking torque-responding type, where the piston is moved forward by the braking torque to close the oil passage and restrict the contracting action of the front fork, or a type that taps hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit to control the contracting action of the front fork.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a movable partition system for refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers that can be used for multi-temperature transport.
* The system includes at least two panels that are independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, allowing each panel to be moved independently.
* The panels are slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails, permitting them to be moved in the fore and aft direction and to be "raised" like garage doors and secured to the ceiling when not in use.
* The panels can be used to separate the trailer into a plurality of zones or areas that can be maintained at different temperatures.
* The system includes a trolley assembly that permits the panels to be moved and secured to the ceiling, and a lift mechanism that raises the panels into a stowed position.
* The panels can be secured relative to one another with a variety of known means, such as cooperating straps and buckles, channels, grooves, flanges, polymeric seals, or locking pins.
* The invention provides a flexible and efficient way to separate and insulate cargo during transportation or storage, and can be used in a variety of configurations to accommodate different types of cargo and trailers.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and sanitary liquid handling systems, which can separate and purify biological macromolecules.
* The valve has a rotor with an elastomeric diaphragm that is integrally molded to form multiple sealing ports, and a stator with corresponding ports that sealably engage the rotor ports.
* The valve has a unique feature of partial separation of the rotor-stator faces to allow flushing across the process fluid-contacting surfaces, and a novel diaphragm-like elastomeric seal that retains sanitizing process fluids when the faces are partially separated.
* The valve has a make-before-break feature that allows for continuous operation of high flow rate pumps without pump-damaging shock waves when the valve is rotated.
* The valve has a barrier fluid flow path that prevents release of process fluid to the environment and prevents accumulation of dried material on the sealing faces.
* The valve can be used in a simulated moving bed (SMB) liquid chromatography system, which can separate and purify biological macromolecules by simulating counter-current movement of the bed.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies, specifically addressing the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid. The invention includes a directional thrust valve assembly with a circular tray valve supported by first and second support legs, oriented into the liquid flow of the tray, and a raised active inlet area for facilitating vapor ascension therethrough.
• The valve assembly includes a plurality of apertures formed in the tray with a valve cover mounted thereon, and the valve cover is mounted by first and second legs, the first leg being disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray and being wider than the second leg. The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure, reducing variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure.
* The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, a fluid regulator, and a generator, which converts the mechanical energy of the vane motor into electrical energy.
* The vane motor uses a unique design with vanes that extend and retract to maximize the drag coefficient and efficiency, allowing the motor to extract work from the pressurized fluid while reducing its pressure.
* The assembly can be used in various applications, including gas grills, self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses, and medical equipment, and can be designed to produce either electrical or mechanical power.
* The invention provides several advantages, including the ability to recover work from a pressurized fluid, reduce the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure, and provide a lightweight and portable assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to pallet systems that facilitate loading and unloading, and limit the shifting of loaded items, particularly for shipping trays with side supports.
* The pallet system includes a pallet base and a pallet cap that fits onto the base, with raised parallel guide rails that allow trays to be slid onto the pallet.
* The guide rails are sized and spaced to constrain the lateral movement of the trays, and end stops are provided to limit the longitudinal movement of the trays.
* End plates are vertically positioned at the front and back ends of the pallet to provide additional stability to the stack of trays and to protect the ends of the trays.
* The end plates are shaped to complement the contours of the trays and can be made of plastic, such as polypropylene or ABS plastic.
* The pallet system can be customized for its intended load, and various features such as the size and position of the guide rails, end stops, and end plates can be varied to suit different types of trays and loads.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which aims to make full use of the limited internal space of the saucer shell and design a rotary-wing system and its power system with a compact structure, reasonable layout, small weight, high motive power conversion efficiency, and easy manipulation and control.
* The flying saucer comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system, where the rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system consisting of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft in the radial direction by a magnetic suspension radial bearing and on the magnetic suspension guide rail in the axial direction by a magnetic suspension axial bearing, allowing for stable and controlled rotation.
* The invention also includes two improvement solutions to overcome the problem of reactive torque of the rotary wing: coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems, which can realize stable and easy power control of the rotary wing.
* The flying saucer designed in the present invention has a compact design structure, reasonable layout, small weight, and high motive power conversion efficiency, and its rotary-wing system and power system can be easily manipulated and controlled, ensuring operational safety and stability.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention concerns streptavidin muteins, a process for their production, and their use in the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins.
* The streptavidin muteins have a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands than wild-type streptavidin, particularly in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53.
* The muteins can be used in affinity chromatography, purification, isolation, or determination methods for recombinant proteins, and can be used in a conventional streptavidin/biotin system.
* The invention also concerns a nucleic acid coding for a streptavidin mutein, a vector containing the nucleic acid, and a cell transformed with the vector.
* The streptavidin muteins can be produced by transforming a host cell with a vector containing a nucleic acid coding for the mutein, culturing the cell under conditions for expression, and isolating the polypeptide.
* The invention is further elucidated by examples and figures, including the production of streptavidin muteins, their use in affinity chromatography, and their characterization by ELISA and fluorescence titration.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is concerned with methods of forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts, specifically guanylating amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
* The nickel catalyst preferably comprises nickel in the zero oxidation state, derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, or nickel on silica/alumina.
* The guanidine functional group is an important structural component in many biologically active compounds, and the invention aims to provide methods for synthesizing guanidines under mild reaction conditions and in high yields.
* The methods of the invention comprise reacting a compound having the structure Formula I with an amine or pyrrolidine, where R1 and R3 of Formula I are Boc groups, or reacting a compound having the structure Formula II with an amine or pyrrolidine, where X of Formula II is selected from the group consisting of alkyl groups and benzyl groups.
* The inventive reactions are preferably carried out at a temperature of from about -30-140° C., and more preferably at room temperature or under ambient conditions, in a solvent system such as DMF, THF, DMSO, or water.
* The nickel catalyst is particularly advantageous due to its relatively inexpensive cost and the fact that it is essentially completely recoverable after the guanylation reactions, allowing it to be reused.
* The invention has been demonstrated through various examples, including the synthesis of isothioureas and thioureas, the guanylation of amines with N,N'-bis-tert-butoxycarbonylthiourea, and the guanylation of amines with N-arylsulfonyl-S-methylisothiourea and N,N'-diphenyl-S-methylisothiourea.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires, allowing for the formation of colored anodic oxide coatings with excellent weatherability or fade resistance.
• The apparatus consists of a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, an electric circuit, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire continuously through the baths.
• The anodic oxidation bath is typically an aqueous solution of 10-55% sulfuric acid, and the electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid.
• The aluminum strip or wire is first anodized in the anodic oxidation bath to form an oxide film, and then immersed in the electrolytic coloring bath to achieve the desired color, with the current density and electrolytic period controlling the color tone.
• The apparatus can produce continuously and with a low cost aluminum strips or wires having colored oxide films or layers superior in weatherability or fade resistance, making it suitable for various industrial applications.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, which can be used for various applications such as DNA library screening, gene function analysis, and directed evolution.
* The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, which are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in the plant cells to produce a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest.
* The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of the different vectors, which are necessary for expressing a function of interest from the DNA sequence of interest.
* The process allows for the selection of transgenic plants or plant cells expressing the function of interest, and can be used to produce transgenic plants or plant cells that are stably transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest.
* The invention also provides for the use of a counter-selectable marker gene to remove plant cells carrying precursor vectors stably integrated into chromosomal DNA, and for the assembly of complex vectors in planta from precursor vectors that are of simpler structure.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas, where a fluorocarbon coating is applied to the swash plate facial surfaces and ends to reduce frictional wear on the components.
• The coating is made from a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load-bearing additive, which are applied to the swash plate using a liquid spray and then cured at an elevated temperature to form a highly adherent coating with high load-bearing and wear-resistant properties.
• The coating can be applied to non-hypereutectic aluminum and aluminum alloys having less than 10% by weight of silicon, and it eliminates the need for expensive, high-silicon aluminum base materials and high surface finishing for the base material.
• The coated swash plate exhibits very smooth facial surfaces and end surface, and it can sustain seizure loads of over ten times greater than uncoated hypereutectic aluminum swash plates and approximately five times those of hypereutectic aluminum swash plates coated with tin or tin/zinc.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, particularly for photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources such as 248 nm (KrF) and 193 nm (ArF) wavelengths. These polymers can be used to form a layer that prevents the reflection of light from lower layers coated on a semiconductor chip, eliminating the standing wave effect and reflection/diffraction caused by changes in the thickness of the photoresist layer itself.
• The polymers of the present invention can be prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, poly(styrene-acrylate) resin, or novolac resin with diazonaphthoquinone halide in the presence of an amine, and can be used to form anti-reflective coatings that are spectroscopically stable under conventional photolithographic conditions. The polymers and compositions of the present invention have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials during the formation of submicro-patterns in photolithographic processes using 248 nm KrF and 193 nm ArF lasers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10-350 μm, which has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties.
* The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and can be produced cost-effectively.
* The film is suitable for outdoor applications and/or critical indoor applications, and can be used for various applications such as interior decoration, exhibition stands, displays, placards, protective glazing, and more.
* The film can be produced using a process that involves extrusion, longitudinal and transverse stretching, and heat-setting, and can be recycled without difficulty and without pollution of the environment.
* The film has a property profile that includes a surface gloss of greater than 15, light transmittance of less than 70%, and a Yellowness Index of less than 5, and can be used for various applications such as interior decoration, exhibition stands, displays, placards, protective glazing, and more.
* Examples of the film's properties and performance are provided, including its ability to pass fire tests and weathering tests, and its suitability for various applications.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The process involves passing 142b and hydrogen fluoride (HF) through a catalyst bed in a reactor at specified conditions, and then purifying the 143a product.
• The catalyst can be any chromium salt, supported or unsupported, and the process can be carried out at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., with a contact time of 1-100 seconds.
• The molar ratio of HF to 142b is crucial, and ratios above 1:1 are required to avoid olefin formation, which can lead to catalyst deactivation.
• The process can be optimized to achieve high conversion and selectivity, and the 143a product can be purified to a high purity level using distillation and other methods.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3##, which is used as a magenta coupler for photographic products.
• The process involves the use of hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce the yield of unwanted impurities.
• The compound can be prepared in two ways: by reaction of 4-amino-5-mercapto-3-substituted(R)-1,2,4-triazoles with alpha-haloketones, or by reaction of 2-hydrazino-5-substituted-(R')-1,3,4-thiadiazines with acyl halides and subsequent dehydrative ring closure.
• The desulfurization of the triazolothiadiazines to the pyrazolotriazoles is effected in two steps: a ring contraction reaction and a hydrolysis and desulfurization reaction.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid in the process reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed during the reaction.
• The process is characterized by generating less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities than when no hypophosphorous acid is present.
• The invention provides a process for the preparation of a 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole from a 3,6-disubstituted-7H-1,2,4-triazolo[3,4-b]-[1,3,4]thiadiazine.
• The process involves reacting the triazolothiadiazine with an acylating agent to form an acylated intermediate, and then reacting the intermediate with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid.
• The invention provides several examples of the process, including the preparation of 6-methyl-3-[1-(4-nitrophenoxy)tridecyl]-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole and 6-t-butyl-3-(3-nitro-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from a plurality of fiber types by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots.
• The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each stored fiber lot before the first pass or each pass, determining a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion, and continuously removing the partial quantity only from the measured fiber lot.
• The partial quantities are taken off the fiber bales in sequence in a predetermined number of bale opening passes, ensuring that all fiber bales are opened without fiber quantities remaining.
• The method allows for the correction of deviations in the partial quantity removed during each pass, as a new calculation is performed for each pass.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener based on signals from the quantity measuring device.
• The quantity measuring device can be a height-measuring arrangement, such as a light barrier or an electromechanically operating sliding potentiometer, which effects a simple and accurate determination of the partial fiber quantities to be removed.
• The control device can be a programmable control that receives signals from the computer and controls the motors of the carriage and the bale opener.
• The method can be performed with a predetermined time period for the removal of the individual quantity proportions, ensuring a uniform supply of fiber tufts to after-connected processing machines.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel yarns, where the yarns in at least two layers are laid at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric. The apparatus includes a rake system that accepts and retains the yarns at the extremities of travel, allowing for parallelism and overlap of successive courses.
• The rake system is synchronized with the conveyors and yarn carriers, and is driven separately from them. It can move a distance equivalent to a full course or a fraction of a full course, allowing for control of the overlap and density of the fabric. The invention also describes the use of a sewing machine or other bonding mechanism to bind the layers of the fabric together.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and an apparatus for inserting a selected weft thread with a weft carrying force appropriate for the selected weft thread in a multiple-color air jet loom.
• The invention aims to provide a stable weft insertion process by adjusting the weft carrying force according to the type of weft thread being inserted, thereby preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.
• The weft carrying force can be adjusted by varying the air pressure, the interval of time in which air is ejected, or a combination of both.
• The invention includes various embodiments, such as dividing subnozzles into groups with different spacings, using subnozzles with different orifice diameters, or supplying air under different pressures to the subnozzles.
• The control system for the weft insertion apparatus can be implemented using mechanical or electric means, such as a cam device or an electric signal generator, to control the air pressure and the interval of time in which air is ejected.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, which aims to provide a simple and efficient process with a low end breakage rate. 
* The process involves health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, drawing the carded bast fibres into bast fibre strips, health preserving the bast fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn.
* The invention has been tested with various bast fibres, including jute, kenaf, hemp, and linen, and blended fibres with other fibres, such as cotton, terylene, polypropylene, and ramee, and has shown a significant reduction in end breakage rate compared to existing technologies.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which includes strategically-placed sensors to measure the pressure being placed against a web that is being advanced through the nip press. The sensors are designed to cancel the effects of rotational variability, which can occur due to the high speed rotation of the sensing roll.
* The sensing roll includes multiple sets of sensors disposed in a particular configuration along the length of the roll, with each set of sensors spaced apart circumferentially from each other. The pressure measurements from each set of sensors are used to calculate and display the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile for the press.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and holder for articles, particularly useful for ironing boards, to keep the cord organized and free from interference while allowing for storage of items like spray starch or beverage containers.
* The device consists of a clamp that attaches to the ironing board, a flexible cord support that can be raised or lowered, and a detachable article holder that can be attached and detached from the clamp.
* The cord support has a coiled spring section that allows it to be raised or lowered, and a foot that can be pivoted and slid to adjust its position, while the article holder has a base and vertical supports to hold items in place.
* The device also includes an extension portion with a female electrical outlet that can be mounted to the clamp, allowing for easy access to power for the iron or other appliances.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that allows for precise control over the length of buttonholes, regardless of the type of material being sewn.
• The device includes a foot pad that attaches to a presser bar and a travelling assembly that moves with the work being fed during sewing.
• The travelling assembly includes a slidable member that can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn, and a tab that acts to trip a lever on the machine to limit the length of the buttonhole.
• An adjustable stop on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of the buttonhole, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point.
• The device is designed to compensate for the varying amounts of slippage that different materials may exhibit relative to the feed dog of the machine, ensuring that buttonholes are formed without overlap or gaps.
• The operator can adjust the device to accommodate different types of materials by readjusting the screw that controls the position of the tripping lever, allowing for perfect buttonholes to be formed in a variety of fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution, which includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The conveyor is an endless sieve belt that transports the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path.
* The liquid applicator applies the liquid to the web during its motion along the path, and the suction device removes the liquid from the web by suction during its motion. The dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop, allowing the liquid to act on the substances to be removed from the web for a longer period.
* The apparatus is particularly advantageous for treating printed materials without soiling the white background, as the washing solution is spread onto the textile web without placing it in a stacked configuration or running it through a vat. It is also suitable for treating knitted materials with little tension.
* The invention can be implemented in various forms, including an air pass and a sieve drum, and can be used for various applications, such as "soilage washing" and fastness treatment.
</summary>

<summary>
• The dry cleaning machine of the present invention provides an air flow system for bringing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, which is exclusive of the air recirculating system and substantially reduces exhausting the residual solvent vapors from the tubs. 
• The machine includes a separate intake fan and duct, a normally closed valve, and a refrigeration system for condensing the vapors in the condenser box and maintaining the liquid solvent in the storage tank at a predetermined temperature to minimize vaporization.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments and melt-spun nonwoven webs using a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width, which produces a linear plane of filaments with substantially constant filament distribution across the machine width.
* The system uses a single source of air for both quenching and drawing the filaments, eliminating the need for two separate air sources and associated equipment, and reducing noise levels and energy consumption.
* The apparatus is designed to be simple and easy to clean, with a small amount of close-tolerance machined surface area exposed to the fiber stream, and can be easily adjusted to change filament denier and production rates, making it suitable for a wide range of applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present disclosure relates to a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that allow sewing in a position specified on a work cloth.
• The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory, and can detect an ultrasonic wave transmitted from a transmission source, identify a position of the transmission source, and control sewing based on the identified position.
• The embroidery unit can be attached to and detached from a bed of a sewing machine, and includes at least one detecting portion and a notifying portion, which can detect an ultrasonic wave and notify the sewing machine of a detection timing.
• The sewing machine can calculate the specified coordinates E by solving simultaneous equations represented by Formulas (13), (14), and (15) based on the detection timings T 2  of the receivers 94, 95, and 96, and can accurately identify the specified position on the work cloth.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material to enhance utility, comprising a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, where the functional additive is carried by the wool particles.
* The preparation can also comprise a mixture of powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents, where the non-charcoal fibrous bamboo powder is nano-sized with an ultrafine particle size of 1 μm or below.
* The invention provides a method of preparing a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprising wool as a functional additive carrier, which involves pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size and forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder.
* The invention also provides a method of preparing a preparation comprising bamboo fibre as a functional additive, which involves pulverizing bamboo fibre to obtain coarse bamboo powder, adding a wetting agent and bamboo powder into water to form a suspension, and pulverizing the coarse bamboo powder in the suspension into ultrafine bamboo powder.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for stitching individual selected patterns into a large fabric such as a bedspread or quilt. The machine includes a sewing machine head with its own computer and a separate computer controlling the quilting table movement, allowing for independent programming and reprogramming of each function.
• The machine uses a computer-aided design program to create and store patterns, which can be duplicated at desired locations on the fabric. The process controller controlling the quilting table movement sends voltage commands to the sewing machine controller, which converts them into RPM commands to perform stitching functions or auxiliary functions.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a method of making nonwoven fabrics, specifically a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image.
* The production of conventional textile fabrics is a complex, multi-step process, whereas nonwoven fabrics are produced directly from the carding process.
* Nonwoven fabrics have been disadvantaged compared to conventional textiles in terms of resistance to elongation, but hydroentangled fabrics have improved properties.
* The invention contemplates a method of making a nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image, comprising providing a first precursor web and a second precursor web, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim interposed between them.
* The precursor webs are advanced onto a moveable imaging surface of the image transfer device, and hydroentanglement is affected to form a three-dimensionally imaged fabric.
* The incorporation of a fiber distribution control layer acts to limit the ability of the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers from becoming excessively intermixed.
* The invention also contemplates the use of a support layer or scrim to provide a median fiber distribution control layer, which deters the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers from becoming excessively intermixed.
* The nonwoven fabric of the invention can be used in a wide variety of applications, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and other end-use products.
* The fabric can be treated with various post-entanglement treatments, such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, or application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, which ensures a continuous operation and makes it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material.
* The device includes a control setup with a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip, and a signal transmitter that is actuated by the movement of the stop to control the switching functions of the sewing machine.
* The device operates by using a strip of material to control the switching functions of the sewing machine, including starting and stopping the sewing operation, lowering the presser foot, and retracting the stop, to ensure a continuous and efficient sewing process.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various parts of clothing.
* The traditional method of linking two tape-shaped knit pieces involves sewing them together, which can be time-consuming and may result in an uneven appearance.
* The invention provides a connective knitting method that allows two tape-shaped knit pieces to be linked together using a flat knitting machine.
* The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces with a boundary between them on a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds.
* The two pieces are positioned with a boundary between them in a longitudinal direction on either of the front and rear needle beds.
* The final course of both knit pieces is overlaid across the boundary, and the overlaid loops are bound off gradually.
* The process is repeated a proper number of times depending on the width of the two tape-shaped knit pieces until they are connected.
* The knitting machine used in the invention has multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds that can move and slide back and forth.
* The machine is controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern to transfer loops between the needle beds and link the two pieces together.
* The invention can be applied to various parts of clothing, such as the collar of a sweater, the neck rope portion of a tanktop, and the lower end portion of baseball stockings.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and a method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material.
• The traction element consists of at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength, with the core strand of each stranded cable sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
• The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, an extruder for co-extrusion of the stranded cables in a flexible plastics material jacket, and a cutting device.
• The method for embedding stranded cables involves unwinding the stranded cables, degreasing and/or pretreating them to improve adhesion, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.
• The production line and method allow for the production of band-shaped traction elements with stranded cables made of twisted steel fibers and a rectangular jacket made of a flexible thermoplastic plastics material, with a high degree of precision and flexibility.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that aims to minimize the impediment of the thread movement during the sewing process.
• The existing rotary hooks have limitations, such as increased needle thread tension due to the retention effect of the front cam or the impediment of the thread movement caused by the holding finger.
• The proposed rotary hook arrangement includes first and second cams arranged on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing, a spring rod extending between the cams, and a capsule release device that gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
• The capsule release device creates a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod, allowing the needle thread loop to slip through unhindered, which reduces the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation.
• The rotary hook arrangement is designed to provide a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, and it has good sewing properties even without the use of a capsule release device.
• The invention aims to provide a simple, rugged, and economical design for the rotary hook arrangement, which can be used in lockstitch sewing machines.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention is a method for producing silicon-based nanowires and composites using liquid silane inks by electrospinning, which is a continuous nanofabrication technique based on electrohydrodynamics.
• The method involves combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent to form a viscous solution, which is then expelled from a nozzle or drawn from a film and exposed to a high electric field to form continuous fibers.
• The fibers are deposited onto a substrate, such as a metallic foil, and can be transformed using thermal processing or laser processing to produce polysilane-containing materials, amorphous silicon-containing materials, or crystalline silicon-containing materials.
• The invention also includes the use of five-component inks, which have the same components as the four-component inks with the addition of a solid phase, such as metallic particles, photoactive particles, or reactive compounds.
• The solid phase component can be used to dope silicon, form semiconducting particles, or create metal silicide wires.
• The invention includes the use of various accelerants, such as polyhydropolysilanes, to increase the setting or curing times of the liquid silane inks.
• The invention also includes the use of various solvents, such as toluene, xylene, and dichloromethane, to dissolve the liquid silane and polymer components.
• The invention includes the use of various polymers, such as poly(methyl methacrylate) and polycarbonate, to form the fibers.
• The invention includes the use of various post-deposition treatments, such as thermal annealing and laser exposure, to transform the fibers into crystalline silicon-containing materials.

</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention is directed to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel having several spool holders, each provided with a brake rotor working with a braking element that is adjustable by a tensioning lever carrying a roller.
* The tensioning lever is biased by the departing thread to take up an angular position dependent upon thread tension and net weight.
* The existing arrangements in the marketplace have the advantage that the force exercised by the braking band automatically decreases as the wind diameter of each spool is reduced.
* The weight distribution on the tensioning lever is predetermined and thus also the thread tension exercised by the creel spools on the threads.
* The invention aims to provide an arrangement for the control of thread tension in a spool creel in which the thread tension for the entire array as well as for individual spool holders can be achieved.
* The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding one of the spool holders, and a tensioning lever coupled to the braking element for biasing it.
* The tensioning lever has a roller adapted to engage and be biased by the threads, and is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
* A biasing arrangement is adapted to be activated by fluid pressure and connected to the tensioning lever, each of the tension levers being simultaneously settable by the fluid pressure.
* The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, whereby the thread tension is also altered, and can be centrally set so that the thread tension can be determined for the entire creel.
* The arrangement allows for a quick braking action to be possible when the warping machine served by the creel is shut off, and the braking force throughout the entire creel can be increased.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The conventional sewing machine detector uses optical fibers for detection, but has several disadvantages, including the need for curved reflecting portions, which are difficult and expensive to machine.
• The conventional detector also has a relatively thick and non-compact detecting section, and the optical fibers are subject to significant stress due to their curvature.
• The invention aims to overcome these disadvantages by providing a low-price detector that is durable despite the detrimental effects of vibration and has a thinner and more compact detecting section.
• The detector of the invention includes a shaft connected to a sewing machine shaft, and a first light shielding disc that detects the sewing machine speed and a needle UP position.
• The first light shielding disc is made of a light-transmitting synthetic resin and has a speed detecting light shielding area, a needle UP position detecting light shielding area, an angle setting scale, and an angle indication.
• The detector also includes a second light shielding disc that detects a needle DOWN position, and a third light shielding disc that detects a thread trimmer timing position.
• The second and third light shielding discs are rotatably mounted to the shaft and have indicator arrows printed thereon for indicating an angle of rotation.
• The detector uses a power indicating optical fiber that runs from the module section to the detecting section, eliminating the need for a regular lead wire and reducing the risk of interference or "noise" problems.
• The invention provides a stable and accurate detection of sewing machine control signals despite shaft vibration, and is less expensive to manufacture and results in a thinner, more compact detecting section.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process involves partial coagulation and drawing, completion of coagulation, washing with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying, which results in a yarn with a degree of whiteness not lower than 45.
* The completion of coagulation can be achieved through various methods, including passing time, acid treatment, or a combination of both.
* The washing process is critical, and the water used should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5, with low levels of cations such as Ca2+ and Mg2+.
* The process can be carried out with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min, and the washing process can be done at temperatures between 20° and 30° C. for a period of 25-40 seconds.
* The invention provides a simplified and economical process for producing high-quality viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, compared to traditional processes that require multiple treatments and longer times.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a continuation-in-part of a patent application filed in 1984, which aimed to improve the process of bleaching pulp with oxygen.
• The problem encountered in the process is the difficulty in washing the pulp after the oxygen stage due to the oxygen entrained in the pulp mat.
• The inventors devised a system to deaerate the pulp before washing, using a small tank with a tangential swirl-inducing inlet pipe.
• The deaeration tank is designed to be the same diameter as the oxygen reactor, allowing it to be placed on top of the reactor.
• The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a filtrate swirler inlet, which provides optimum deaeration.
• The filtrate from the washer is used as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank.
• The deaeration tank is designed to be a closed tank, allowing steam or oxygen to be recovered.
• The tank is equipped with a height sensor to control the flow of pulp and maintain a constant height in the tank.
• The system is designed to handle pulp slurries with a consistency of 8-15% and can be operated at atmospheric pressure or under low pressure or vacuum.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. 
* The BTR composite materials are designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which employs topology optimization to optimize material distribution and improve structural performance.
* The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be curved or flat, and can be arranged in various configurations to achieve optimal structural performance.
* The BTR composite materials have several advantages, including the ability to absorb impact energy, dissipate vibration energy, and provide ultra-lightweight structures, making them suitable for various applications, including aerospace, marine, and vehicular body parts.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device that can be used in a braced frame structure to dissipate energy during a dynamic event, such as an earthquake, and limit the loads transmitted to the structure.
• The load-limiting device can be designed to undergo plastic deformation in response to high loads, allowing it to absorb and dissipate energy, and can be removed and replaced after a dynamic event.
• The device can be connected to the braced frame structure using a connection means, such as a high-strength bolt, and can be designed to have a plastic hinge mechanism that can deform in response to a dynamic event.
• The load-limiting device can be used in various shapes and sizes, and can be designed to accommodate different bracing configurations, such as X-braces or K-braces, and can be used in both internal and external bracing systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for a flophouse facility, which provides a number of individual rooms on the floor of an existing building. The cabinet has a floor area approximately equal to the area of a bed, a height allowing users to erect the upper half of their body, and a circumference completely shut off from the outside except for a doorway.
• The conventional bedroom cabinet has a box-shape formed by six single-layer panels, but it has several disadvantages, such as reduced dwelling area and decreased mechanical strength. The present invention aims to overcome these disadvantages by providing a dual construction comprising an outer casing and an inner casing.
• The bedroom cabinet of the present invention is formed into a box-shape by a hexahedron consisting of four side surfaces, an upper surface, and a lower surface. The outer casing is composed of upper and lower outer casings, which are integrally formed and have a notch portion corresponding to the upper or lower half of the exit.
• The inner casing is positioned within the outer casing and comprises a front surface panel, a back panel, left and right side panels, a ceiling panel, and a bottom panel. The clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing can be used to form a box for accommodating electric devices or a shelf for accommodating user's belongings.
• The present invention further provides a bedroom cabinet with a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing, which is formed over the whole periphery and houses spacer members with venting grooves. This design allows for natural ventilation and increased sound-proofing effect.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the construction industry, particularly in high-rise apartment and office building construction, to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights.
* The guard rail support consists of a substantially flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, at least one guard rail support bracket, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring, which can be assembled and disassembled in an efficient manner to meet safety guidelines and prevent accidental falls.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) that combines pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate crude oil reservoirs and process the recovered crude oil into its components.
* The device uses a rapid release of electrical energy stored in capacitor banks to generate high power output, which can be harnessed in various industrial, chemical, or medical applications.
* The energy release can be used in a direct plasma mode or by discharging the energy through a single- or multiple-turn coil that generates a short-lived but extremely intense magnetic field.
* The invention includes a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations that are generated using both EH and EM pulsed power discharge devices.
* The EH mode uses a plasma channel created by releasing electricity across a spark gap submerged in water, generating a shock wave that vaporizes the surrounding water and creates high pressures and temperatures.
* The EM mode uses a coil to produce controlled flux compression that can generate various physical effects without the coupled effect of the EH strong acoustic wave.
* The invention includes a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well in a time sequence that is optimized to allow continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation of a large reservoir volume.
* The invention also includes the use of EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, allowing a wider range of discharge pulse durations that will extend the effective frequency range of induced vibrations.
* The invention can be used in various configurations, including a single EH source, a vertical array of sources, or multiple wellbores, and can be combined with additional materials such as steam, water, a surfactant, a diluent, or CO2 to increase the mobility of the hydrocarbon and/or increase the flow of hydrocarbon.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present disclosure is a continuation-in-part of a co-pending U.S. patent application Ser. No. 12/684,479, which was filed on Jan. 8, 2010, and is related to a wave anchor soil reinforcing connector and method.
• The disclosure describes Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, which use horizontally positioned soil inclusions to reinforce an earth mass in combination with a facing element.
• A typical soil reinforcing element includes a welded wire grid with a pair of longitudinal wires and a plurality of transverse wires, and is used in the construction of MSE structures.
• The disclosure describes a splice for a soil reinforcing element, which includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate, each with transverse protrusions to receive and seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
• The splice is secured by coupling the first wave plate to the second wave plate using a connective device, such as a threaded bolt, and is used to extend the length of a soil reinforcing element into adjacent backfill.
• The disclosure also describes a composite soil reinforcing element, which includes a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and a splice that couples the two, allowing for the extension of the soil reinforcing element's length to achieve a desired reinforcing distance from a vertical facing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, allowing for efficient production and easy maintenance. The plow blade is constructed with a multiple component assembly, enabling the replacement of worn parts and customization of the fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements.
* The fluid injection system can be tailored by varying the length of the fluid tube, the number of leading edge sections, and the location and size of the stitch welds or nozzles, allowing for a nearly infinite variety of configurations to suit different soil conditions and installation depths.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a building system, specifically stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc.
* The invention aims to provide a building system that allows panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height to be created and/or greater than 4 meters width to be created without movement joints.
* The system consists of a frame or substructure, battens supported from and fixed to the frame or substructure, a first mesh (inner mesh) attached to the battens, a second mesh (outer mesh) supported at least in part by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix applied as more than one layer.
* The plaster matrix penetrates the first mesh, interposes both meshes, attaches to the second mesh, and covers the second mesh.
* The system also includes regional reinforcement, such as metallic mesh, and lattice-like periphery defining members.
* The invention also includes a method of in situ formation of a reinforced plaster panel as cladding of a support structure, comprising fixing battens to the support structure, preparing for the panel creation, applying plaster into and onto the inner mesh, overlaying the second and levelling coat with a mesh, and applying a third plaster coat onto the second and levelling coat or the second and levelling coat and the at least partially embedded outer mesh.
* The system is designed to meet the requirements of the Building Code, including Clause B1—Structural Integrity, Clause B2—Durability, Claims C—Spread of Fire (resistance), and Clause E2—External Moisture.
* The system includes various components and consumables, such as battens, flashing tape, powder-coated aluminium Z flashings, mesh staples, batten nails, sealant, and plaster and sealer.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a new and improved safe and door structure that provides a readily assembled, low-cost door and safe structure. 
* The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a first set of inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped separate steel door. 
* The door is retained in place by a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls, with one groove having a depth substantially greater than the other, and a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door that engages a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement. 
* The safe construction can be formed using a cast-in-place concrete construction, or an all-metal construction, and can be modified to eliminate certain components for a more economical design.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fluid pressure measuring technique that accurately measures the fluid pressure in a geological formation at a desired depth or elevation, without being influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the pressure measuring apparatus. This is achieved by cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and then displacing the grout to form a fluid connection between the formation and the filter.
* The invention also includes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure the formation pressures at desired depths. These systems involve isolating the inlet to the pressure sensing apparatus to pressures produced by the formation at the desired depth, and using a packer and pressure transducer to measure the formation pressure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given the maintenance.
• The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
• The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and the present invention employs elastic members mainly consisting of laminated rubber.
• The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and the adequate management of accuracy of each member if given may be adapted to prevent the differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.
• The elastic members and the joint block are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like and consequently, may be easily given the maintenance thereof as well.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a track transport system, specifically a floor track system used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks.

• The conventional method of chilling cooked meat products involves rolling racks or hand trucks into a cooling chamber and circulating chilled air, which has the major drawback of evaporating meat juices and causing dehydration.

• More recent approaches employ fluid treatment chambers with a system for showering the meat products with a chilled brine solution to quickly transfer heat from the meat to the solution.

• The brine solution is then recooled and recirculated, but the volume of water needed is significant, making it economically advantageous to recover and reuse the brine solution.

• The meat products must be processed in a sanitary environment as required by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and the method of transporting cooked meat into and out of the fluid treatment chamber must maintain the sanitary condition of the chamber.

• Overhead rail or trolley systems have been used with a certain degree of success, but they suffer from the disadvantage of fixing the route of transfer and contaminating the brine solution.

• Wheeled dolly-like floor trucks have been used, but they are unsanitary and can contaminate the brine solution.

• The present invention provides a floor transport system that allows dolly-like floor trucks to be used in a fluid treatment center in a manner that prevents the wheels or other support structure on the dolly from contaminating the treatment fluid.

• The enclosed floor track system includes a wheel channel into which the wheels of the truck roll, and which is disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs.

• The enclosed floor track system prevents showered or dripping brine from entering into the track system, and what little solution which may enter the tracks and become contaminated is drained away separately from the solution on the chamber floor.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, particularly a boom of a backhoe work machine, to prevent it from being rotated downward by its weight.
