* The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin), where the engaging member is provided on the boom and the engaged member is provided on the boom bracket.
* The engaging member is supported by a support pin and a guide member, which guides the engaging member to maintain the lock position at any rotation position of the boom.
* The lock device is designed to be easy to operate manually, and the engaging member can be held in the lock position or the lock release position by sliding along a slot and touching a guide member with either the first or second surface of the engaging member.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency during pool cleaning operations.
• The apparatus has a central, vacuum portion that is readily adjustable relative to the pool bottom, enabling real-time adjustment of suction without needing to adjust the suction source.
• The adjustment is accomplished using conveniently located mechanisms on the top of the suction head, which regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central suction portion and the pool bottom.
• The invention also includes a roller height adjustment device that can be added to existing suction head assemblies with minimal modification, allowing for precise adjustment of the inboard rollers relative to the platform.
• The roller height adjustment device includes a frame, an elongated connector, a wing nut, a coil spring, and four axles, which can be assembled to an existing unit in a simple and straightforward manner.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil and gas well drilling operations.
* Wear bushings are used to protect against excessive wear on casing heads and other well head elements.
* The existing method of retrieving wear bushings involves using a retriever body with a J-slot and dowels to engage the wear bushing, but this method has a shortcoming in that the retriever body must be secured in rigid engagement with the exterior of the pipe.
* The present invention provides a retriever apparatus that is removably securable on the exterior surface of a sub-unit, allowing it to be mounted on a string of drill pipe independently of threading on the pipe.
* The retriever apparatus has a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that is slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit.
* The retriever section has protruding members that engage with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing, allowing the retriever section to move vertically along the mandrel while preventing free rotational movement.
* The retriever apparatus allows for vertical play of the retriever section, preventing damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing due to excessive weight.
* The retriever apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.
* The retriever apparatus is easily removable and installable, allowing for quick removal of the wear bushing during drilling operations.
* An additional embodiment of the retriever section has a threaded lower end section for retrieving wear bushings with threaded collar sections.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a passage and be subsequently closed by landing a plug on a seat.
* The tool has a modular design that allows selection of the number of pistons to increase the available piston area and power delivery.
* The pistons are stacked to increase the power of the pressure spike applied to the stuck fish.
* The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, depending on the amount of overpull applied to the string.
* The valve is designed as an annular ring, allowing wireline access through the tool and eliminating the need for a dart assembly.
* The valve opens and closes without slamming against a seat, reducing wear and increasing the life of the tool.
* The tool can be made to operate with fewer moving parts than previous designs, reducing the risk of failure.
* The design of the valve and spring allows for cyclical loading without fatigue or failure.
* The tool can be used in stimulation or fishing operations, providing large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string.
* The tool can also have a rotational lock between the mandrel and housing for torque transmission.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention pertains to an apparatus and method of installation for a completely precast concrete retaining wall, typically used alongside highways and railways, which allows for taller walls and shorter bases.
* The retaining wall consists of two discrete, modular parts: a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece, which can be connected using a shear key and grout.
* The counterfort provides additional support to the wall, and can be designed with various shapes and configurations, including a flat bottom and a horizontal top ledge.
* The connection between the face panel and base piece can be made by inserting rebar ends from the counterfort into openings in the base, and sealing with grout, allowing for flexibility and stability in the wall.
* The retaining wall can be customized to various sizes and configurations, and can be used in conjunction with additional features such as H-piles, vehicle impact barriers, and drainage systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving production in oil and gas wells with low flow rates due to high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
* The system addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional down hole heaters: (1) heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and (2) existing heaters fail due to lack of protection for electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
* The system includes a heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars to contain heat in the production zone and prevent heat loss through conduction.
* The heating unit is designed to prevent physical and chemical attack of electrical connections and to prevent electrical shorts due to invasion of conductive fluids.
* The system uses a cement block to encase the heater rods and a steel fitting assembly to shield the electrical connections, and solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation to deliver power to the connection.
* The method of use of the system includes installation of the heat-retaining elements and suitably shielded electrical connections to properly focus heat on the producing formation, and may also be used with cable (wire line) for supporting the heating unit.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore. The mechanism is designed to effectively connect and disconnect from the object using a simple mechanical movement of a wire line controlled pulling tool.
• The mechanism includes an outer tubular body and an inner body structure disposed in movable relation within the outer body. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore.
• The mechanism includes a catch mechanism having a locking position and an unlocking position, depending on the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures. A pin structure forming a part of the catch mechanism is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves, and a control spring is employed to ensure that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves.
• The mechanism allows for controlled latching and unlatching of the pulling tool mechanism, enabling operating personnel to provide efficient selective control. The mechanism can be latched and unlatched as many times as necessary to accomplish the service operation involved, and it can be easily replaced with a heavier-duty mechanism if needed.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present application claims the benefit of a PCT International Patent Application and two Mexico patent applications, with the entirety of their contents incorporated by reference.
• The invention relates to stave floors, specifically modular composed stave floors, and aims to address drawbacks in existing composed stave floors.
• Existing composed stave floors have a thin sight substrate (2-3 mm) that is prone to deformation and detachment when sanded or rushed.
• The base substrate is typically composed of slung wood or triplay, joined by glue, which can lead to deformations and changes in dimensions.
• The invention proposes a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate thickness of at least 12 mm.
• The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement means.
• The multidirectional holding means provide a firm bond between the substrates, preventing displacement or change of dimensions.
• The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate and provide a longer lifespan for the floors.
• The floors can be provided with a glaze from the supplier, eliminating the need for on-site application and improving durability.
• The invention provides improved composed stave floors with increased durability and the ability to provide corrective maintenance.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladder attachments that improve the stability and safety of ladders, particularly when used on uneven or corner surfaces.
• The attachment includes a brace assembly that has a flange with openings for a U-bolt, which encircles a rung of the ladder, and a clamp that secures the assembly to the siderail.
• The attachment also includes a resilient pad assembly that pivots on the arm of the brace assembly, allowing it to adjust to different surfaces and prevent damage to the work surface.
• The invention aims to provide a non-slip gripping portion for the ladder that increases the contact area with the work surface, improving lateral stability and allowing the ladder to straddle corners.
• The attachment can be installed on either side of the ladder and can be adjusted to accommodate different sizes of ladders and work surfaces.
• The invention provides a solution to the problems of ladder instability, damage to work surfaces, and difficulty in reaching corners, making it a useful improvement for ladder safety and functionality.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, defining a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions.
* The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy, or the like. The material can be preheated prior to molding to enhance adhesion to the fasteners.
* The nail strip includes a row of fasteners arranged substantially parallel to each other, with the plastic collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
* The connecting portion includes a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location. The weakened region can be formed by a notch, a varying cross-sectional area, or a thin-walled sleeve section.
* The nail strip can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, reducing debris generation and corrugation of the strip.
* Various embodiments of the nail collation system are disclosed, including configurations with tapered connecting portions, embossed patterns, and reinforced or stiffening elements to enhance rigidity and predictability in separation while minimizing material usage and debris generation.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industrial applications, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design.
* The nozzle is designed to facilitate the injection of sealants in multiple industrial applications and to provide a precise dispersion of the sealant.
* The nozzle has an outlet shaped as a bell or hood to facilitate the encapsulation of rivets or screws.
* The injection button has a number of channels and orifices for carrying out sealing operations with greater accuracy.
* The nozzle can be used with both manual cartridges and automatic processes using injection machines.
* The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape.
* The nozzle has a connecting hollow round section with a threaded exterior surface for coupling to a sealant-containing cartridge or injection machine.
* The nozzle has a protruding ring that acts as a stopper in the insertion or threading of the cartridge and reinforces the area of greatest pressure.
* The nozzle can be used to apply sealants in various applications, including sealing operations involving injecting sealants in chamfers and orifices.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a position sensor that can be used to monitor the position of an object in a mechanical system, such as an internal combustion engine.
• The sensor uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and provide a conditioned sensing signal to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The error correction generator uses a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor to determine and eliminate strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed.
• The sensor uses a window reference circuit to constantly compare a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjust the output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
• The sensor can be recalibrated at any time by external means by simply removing and reapplying power, and it can also be recalibrated rapidly due to sudden changes in offset voltage caused by rapid temperature or other changes.
• The sensor is designed to minimize energy consumption and can operate with a minimum of current drawn, making it suitable for use in systems where power is limited, such as in vehicles utilizing storage batteries.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention is a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines that eliminates the need for springs and provides a substantially infinitely variable valve actuation system.

• The system consists of a rotating cam and translating means that interact with a second controllable actuating means to control valve position and percentage of port opening.

• The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which receives an input from a timing belt driven by the engine's output shaft.

• The rotary cam has a grooved track in a circular flat disk that displaces a translating means, which is a ball constrained in a slide that reciprocates in a slot.

• The slot presents an angle to the line of action of the first translating means, and pins affixed to the valve ride in the slot, allowing the valve to move up and down as the slot reciprocates.

• The system can be controlled by an adjustable member that rotates a link to any angle, allowing the slot to be positioned at any angle and controlling the amount of port opening.

• The system can be controlled by a computer to operate any set of pistons, allowing for variable valve displacement and the ability to close any number of cylinders while the engine is performing.

• The system can be used in various engine designs, including four-stroke and multi-valve engines, and can be controlled by a central control system with position information of the hydraulic cylinders.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, which can be controlled to provide a range of color temperatures and intensities.
* The light member includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side that includes multiple control channels for controlling different types of light.
* The light member also includes one or more light-emitting modules that can be releasably coupled to the lighting control region and to one of the channels to emit white or blue light.
* The modules can be positioned anywhere along the lighting control region and can be easily removed or replaced as desired.
* The light member can be controlled using a switch or a timer, and can be used with various types of enclosures and structures, including underneath office or kitchen cabinets to provide lighting beneath the cabinets.
* The invention provides a flexible and adjustable lighting system that can be customized to meet the needs of different users and applications.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine that operates at high temperatures.
* The apparatus is generally known from the prior art, but has several disadvantages, including high material temperature, thermal stresses, and complex casting.
* The object of the invention is to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that is simple to produce, can be flexibly matched to the respective application, and is efficiently cooled.
* The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts which are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured.
* The use of inserts has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, and reduced centrifugal-force stresses.
* A first preferred embodiment of the flow deflection apparatus is in the form of a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls.
* A second preferred embodiment of the invention secures the inserted separating walls by an integral material joint, preferably by soldering or welding.
* The invention is particularly advantageous for rotor blades which rotate at high speed, as it reduces the blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for either automatic or manual control of the throttle valve.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
* The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control, and provides full operation of the vehicle when in manual control, without impairing the safety of the vehicle driver or hampering the operation of the vehicle.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste, aiming to provide a clean-burning waste fuel burner.

• The conventional hog fuel burners are inefficient in combustion, discharging undesirable amounts of gaseous and particulate pollution, and require frequent and expensive cleaning.

• The invention aims to provide a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and effectively burns wet wood of 70% moisture content.

• The burner includes a primary combustion chamber where preheated underfire air percolates up through the fuel pile, drying and gasifying the waste fuel.

• High-pressure swirl air is introduced tangentially to the primary chamber, generating centrifugal forces that drive heavier non-combusted materials to the outer wall while allowing volatile gases to pass upward.

• The volatile gases are then partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially in a first or primary combustion chamber.

• The secondary combustion chamber is provided with a side wall, roof, outlet, and refractory lining, where secondary combustion air is introduced to complete combustion.

• The flame holder serves as a barrier, preventing the secondary chamber inner vortex from drawing primary chamber particulate material up into the secondary chamber.

• The invention can be adjusted to operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and the underfire air and swirl air can be shut down quickly to change the output Btu/hr of the heater.

• The control system includes a pneumatic control diagram that regulates the air and wood feed rate, fan output, and underfire air flow to maintain a stable and efficient combustion process.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to separate the dry and wet sides, allowing for efficient cooling without adding water vapor to the useful air. The system operates by drawing working air from the load, passing it through the wet side of the heat exchanger, and then passing the cooled air through the dry side of the heat exchanger.
* The system can be modified to include a vapor compression refrigeration unit, which can further cool a portion of the air stream and dehumidify it, resulting in a more efficient and effective cooling system. This hybrid system can achieve significant reductions in energy required to operate the vapor compression refrigeration unit.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a fluid pump that can pump fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure, particularly for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir.
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads connected in series, with each pump head having a housing, an impeller, and a drive structure.
* The pump heads are connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal between them, and the drive structure is configured to commonly drive the impellers.
* The fluid pump has a unique design feature where the first and second pump heads have different design features to permit fluid flow from one pump head to the other, while commonly driving the impellers.
* The fluid pump also has a combiner for combining fluid flow from the conduits into a single fluid flow, and the combiner may comprise a fluid chamber in which fluid flow from the conduits are combined into the single flow.
* The fluid pump can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to permit operation of the pump at a fluid reservoir.
* The fluid pump can be used for various applications, including pumping liquid manure from a reservoir, and can be designed to have a high operating pressure by adjusting the number of pump heads in the series.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes, specifically for engines having less than all engine cylinders equipped with brakes.
• Traditional engine compression release brake systems include an engine brake for each engine cylinder, but this can result in excess components and reduced overall robustness.
• The present invention aims to overcome this problem by providing an engine compression release brake system with a sufficient but reduced number of components.
• The invention includes an engine with an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, and an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders.
• The portion of engine cylinders with brakes is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders.
• A method of engine braking using less than all engine cylinders includes attaching an engine compression release brake to an engine housing for a portion of the engine cylinders and operating the portion in a braking mode.
• The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve, and the brake includes a hydraulic system with a high pressure pump, a high pressure manifold, and a low pressure reservoir.
• The brake also includes an electronic control module that controls the operation of the brake and determines when engine braking is desirable and how much braking horsepower is required.
• The brake can be activated during the compression stroke of a piston, and once activated, it can be de-activated when the desired braking horsepower is achieved.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads caused by events like blade-off.
• The mounting link includes a male link and a female link that can translate relative to each other, forming a radial interface that dampens the translation.
• A pin is releasably coupled to the male and female links to selectively retain them.
• The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly and the engine mounting structure.
• The pin can be formed of a less durable material than the female and male links to facilitate the desired shear characteristics.
• After the pin is sheared, the female and male links are allowed to translate relative to each other, and the radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation.
• The amount of coulomb damping provided by the radial interface is determined by the coefficient of friction, the geometry, and the contact areas of the female and male links.
• A snap ring can be used to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link.
• The use of the pin and the coulomb damping provided by the radial interface obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving extreme loads produced during fan blade-off events.
• The pin can be replaced with an intact pin during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break the pin.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to archery equipment, specifically to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts, aiming to solve the shortcomings of the prior art such as stress exerted on the wall of the shaft and dirt entering the shaft through unsealed ends.
* The invention provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight, allowing for perfect balance to be easily obtained. It also includes a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft.
* The invention includes various embodiments such as a point cap, a point adaptor, a nock cap, and a balance pin, which work together to provide a means of attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft, and to balance the arrow shaft with adjustable weight.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
• The SAFES uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system to produce sound and flash.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt to simulate realistic operator actions.
• The circuitry consists of ten functional blocks, including a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, and firing control, which are implemented using CMOS IC's, SCR's, diodes, capacitors, resistors, and switches.
• The firing control circuitry uses thirty-one SCR's to trigger pyrotechnic charges, which are contained in a plastic expendable structure with a series of cups, each holding a shaped pyrotechnic pellet.
• The SAFES is packaged to resemble a magazine clip for the M16 rifle, with a reusable housing that contains the electrical control circuitry and the plastic expendable, and is designed to be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device of an internal combustion engine that aims to improve engine performance by utilizing the dynamic effects of air flow while reducing noise from the air intake.
• The device comprises a tank, a first pipe with a larger cross-sectional area, and a second pipe with a smaller cross-sectional area, which are connected to the intake passage at different locations. A control valve is disposed in the first pipe and is actuated by an actuator responsive to engine operating conditions.
• The provision of the narrow passage in the second pipe constitutes a resonator that absorbs noise, and the location of the second pipe near the air cleaner is preferred to minimize its influence on the dynamic effect.
• The operation of the control valve is controlled based on engine speed and load conditions, and the valve is preferably closed at low loads and opened at high loads and high engine speeds to improve engine performance while reducing noise.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket assembly consisting of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, designed for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. The adjustable bracket can be easily positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface or pole.
• The assembly allows for simple and effective installation by one person, without the need to support the weight of the object and handle attachment hardware simultaneously. It also provides resistance to weather, wind, and vibration, and can be used on various surfaces and pole sizes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a burner for a heat utilizing appliance, which is part of a system including a plurality of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances.
* The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.
* The burner also has a shroud providing a second wall that surrounds the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns.
* The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner, which can include closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.
* The burner can be used with a pyrolyzer that includes a substantially air-tight heating chamber for pyrolyzing carboniferous materials, and can also be provided with a fuel feed feature to enable renewing the fuel supply during operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The rotary internal combustion engine has a water cooling system that is crucial for improving fuel economy and durability, but it faces challenges in cooling the area surrounding the spark plugs, which can lead to housing distortion and thermal fatigue.
* The traditional in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water jacket passageway disrupts the flow of cooling fluid, leading to vapor film collection and reduced heat transfer.
* The spark plug bosses in a rotary engine are cast in close proximity to the circumference of each rotor housing, affecting half of the total heat of combustion for a two-rotor engine.
* The in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses creates a flow shadow effect, preventing a controlled flow regime and deteriorating heat transfer.
* A new design is proposed, where the spark plug bosses are staggered with respect to the direction of flow, promoting a relatively close in-line arrangement of the spark plug terminals.
* The staggered arrangement allows for separate paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer, reducing locally high thermal conditions and improving the distribution of coolant velocities around the boss surface.
* Tests were conducted on a water model passageway simulating the passage plug bosses, showing that the staggered spark plug configuration increased the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line arrangement.
* The proposed design aims to maintain an efficient level of combustion while improving cooling characteristics to reduce the possibility of structural failure of the engine's housing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, using control valve positions as feedback to minimize such flow disturbance.
• The method involves maintaining the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant, which minimizes steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during inlet control valve testing.
• The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one of the parallel flow paths during valve testing results in a change to the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves.
• The test compensation circuit uses control valve positions as feedback and compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valve during testing.
• The use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95% compared to a control system without flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, specifically designed for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet.
• The mixing valve allows for a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
• The valve system consists of a valve body, a first inlet passage for receiving a first fluid, a second inlet passage for receiving a second fluid, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to 100% second fluid, 0% first fluid.
• The valve system includes a spool valve, a flow restricting device, and a handle for adjusting the valve.
• The spool valve has a cylindrical portion with a bore that is radially offset from another bore, allowing for differing proportional mixtures of the two fluids to emerge from the outlet passage.
• The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage, from approximately 0% water, 100% soap solution, to 100% water, 0% soap solution.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, where the gas is compressed to a higher pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure.
* The invention aims to reduce the required investments and operation risk by utilizing the physical effect of cooling a compressed gas when expanded to a lower pressure, either by throttling or with the simultaneous performance of work.
* The compressor station according to the invention includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, at least one heat exchanger for cooling compressed gas, valve-controlled pipelines for connecting the compressor and the heat exchanger to one another and to the gas pipeline, as well as control units for controlling the compressor and the valves.
* The invention provides a flexible operation mode, allowing the compressor station to be operated differently depending on the season, with the possibility of using the principal units of the compressor stations throughout the entire year, and reducing the risk of accidents due to the absence of re-cooling units.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure, which can be used in various applications including the automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation industries.
* The system includes a cooling fan assembly with a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier, which is mounted to a panel using a unique fastening mechanism.
* The motor carrier has a plurality of mounting legs with turned-out portions that are inserted into recesses on the panel, and spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel.
* The installation process involves bringing the cooling fan assembly into contact with the panel, applying a compressive and rotating force to compress the spring members and move the turned-out portions into the recesses.
* As the cooling fan assembly is rotated, the resilient leg portions of the mounting legs enter into intermediate and residual openings on the panel, and the spring members remain in a compressed state to prevent vibrational noise and "backing out" of the leg portions.
* The system eliminates the need for fasteners, reducing labor and handling costs associated with traditional fastening techniques.
* The invention is applicable to any application where forced air movement is relied upon for adequate cooling of heat-generating systems, and can be modified or adapted to suit various needs and requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The current kinematic mounts used in spacecraft structures have limited success in minimizing loads transmitted to the instrument due to their lack of damping features, which can lead to potentially damaging flight loads.
* The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from flight loads, and to achieve modal vibration tests on coupon sample mounts that yield modal damping values from 5-17% of critical damping.
* The invention includes two preferred embodiments of damper designs: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper, which can be used to dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat and reduce the high energy disturbances to the instrument.
* The damped kinematic mounts can be designed to have a center-of-gravity mounting system, which can uncouple the six suspension vibration modes of the instrument, providing improved performance in applications where dynamic disturbances are inherent within the instrument.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a clutch unit of the oil shear type, designed for large size power transmission requirements, particularly in aircraft catapult systems. It features interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.
* The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for dual purposes: retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag, and as a coolant for the clutch discs. The fluid pressure control means supply pressurized fluid in parallel to all piston and cylinder means, minimizing residual drag.
* The clutch unit also features a segmental disc arrangement, allowing for the easy removal and replacement of individual disc segments without disassembling the entire mechanism. This is achieved through a system of bushings, keys, and bridges that hold the segments in place.
* The invention provides a new and improved clutch unit with several key features, including improved cooling, reduced disc friction, and minimized residual drag. The centrifugal force of the oil is used to retract the discs, eliminating the need for retraction springs and minimizing the risk of malfunction.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a combined engine system that includes a combustion cylinder and an expansion cylinder, where the expansion cylinder receives hot exhaust gas from the combustion cylinder and also receives a source of water that is expanded into steam by the hot exhaust gas to create further drive for a common crankshaft.
• The system aims to minimize heat loss and maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction, with the goal of eliminating the need for a radiator. This is achieved through the use of multiple expansion cylinders, water injection, and a water recovery system.
• The system also includes features such as catalytic conversion of impurities in the gases, water recovery and re-use, and the use of high-temperature, water-lubricated polymeric materials in critical places within the construction of the second cascade.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention aims to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas within welded assemblies, which are sources of the onset of rupture, and to provide a fabrication process that ensures good corrosion resistance and is economically viable.
• The invention involves coating a steel plate with a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy, and removing the metal alloy layer in an area at the periphery of the plate.
• The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed must be adjusted to enable welding with no introduction of any element of the precoat into the molten area and sufficient corrosion resistance of the welded assembly after subsequent alloying and austenizing heat treatment.
• The invention provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate that includes coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat having an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate, and cutting the plate in a plane so that the area from which the metal alloy has been removed is at the periphery of the cut plate.
• The invention also provides a part fabrication method wherein a welded blank fabricated according to a preferred embodiment of the invention is heated to form, by alloying between the steel substrate and the coating, an intermetallic alloy compound, and so as to confer a partially or totally austenitic structure on the steel, then the blank is hot deformed to obtain a part.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention is a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system for remote control of a mobile structure that recovers energy from an offshore marine environment.
* The system optimizes energy extraction using an algorithm that accounts for data from weather observations, sensors on the mobile structure, and performance models for the mobile structure.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, such as Global Positioning Satellite (GPS) systems, weather satellites, and weather data disseminating entities.
* The system uses a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to allow remote humans to interact with the system and choose mission-critical navigation plans.
* The GUI displays various information, including the position, heading, velocity, and points of sail for the mobile structure.
* The system uses a Velocity Prediction Program (VPP) to perform Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) calculations on the sailing vessel and its energy-extracting appendage.
* The system also includes an advanced physical object detection, identification, and avoidance system that remotely utilizes integrated sensors to detect and avoid physical objects.
* The system uses a weighted anisotropic energy yield raster to assign weights to suggested routes based on direction and length, and to select the highest yield path or the shortest logistical trajectory.
* The system allows human operators to choose mission-critical navigation parameters, such as cost and yield weights and cost or yield goals, and to optionally choose a path that yields the highest energy in the shortest time with least risk to structural harm to the mobile structure.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The invention aims to reduce production costs associated with the manufacture of rolling body guide cages.
* A rolling body guide cage according to the invention is composed of a ring element produced from a sheet metal material and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably cut out from a sheet metal material and formed as 120° ring segments.
* Only three weld points are required for joining together a ring element composed of such flat material ring segments.
* The ring segments can be punched out from a sheet metal strip in close succession, and the circular arc-like inner and outer edges and the joint geometries can be cut out in one step.
* The ring element can be produced by welding the flat material ring segments together in the region of a joint formed by these flat material ring segments.
* The welding can be performed by laser welding, which produces a high-strength weld point with a low degree of welding distortion.
* The ring segments can be produced with a slight oversize and further cut and calibrated after welding in the context of a contouring step.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides methods and systems for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including requesting and obtaining coordinates associated with the location, and updating databases with the coordinates. The coordinates can be used to provide directions for a service technician traveling between multiple customer service locations.
* The system includes a technician server, a global positioning satellite system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer record system, which work together to acquire and store information associated with customer service locations, and to provide directions for service technicians.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
* The system has three pairs of compensation coils and a control unit to protect an object from interfering fields.
* The control unit is preferably a digital signal processor (DSP) or a field-programmable gate array (FPGA).
* The system combines the output signals of the two real sensors into three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable averaging algorithm.
* The averaging takes place in the control system, which receives the six output signals of the two real magnetic field sensors via six inputs.
* The algorithm used by the control system can be described as O=L·Ω(M·S), where O are the control signals, L is a 6×6 matrix, Ω is the control algorithm, M is the 6×6 matrix describing the averaging, and S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors.
* In case of a Helmholtz coil arrangement, only one coil of the pair is actively actuated, and the position of the single coil does not need to be rearranged in case of a change of the structure of the interfering field.
* If two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, feedback effects may arise between the two systems, which can be accounted for by providing a 6×6 back coupling matrix C.
* The 6×1 matrix of the real sensor signals is expanded by the feedback part, and the 6×1 matrix with the virtual sensor signals is calculated from the signals Ŝ expanded by the feedback part.
* The control signals are calculated according to the relation O=L·Ω(M·(S−C·O)), where C is the 6×6 feedback matrix.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for CARS microscopy that involves furnishing at least one resonance site in a sample derived from a biological source by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
* The method allows for the creation of resonance sites in the sample, which can be used for image production in CARS microscopy, and can also be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as clinicians in training or different software systems, by comparing them against a "gold standard" segmentation approved by a clinician.
* The system accepts as inputs, segmentations or "regions of interest" (ROIs) recorded in electronic files, for example, using the DICOM-RT standard.
* The segmentations are converted to volume models and the volume models are compared to identify volume elements that are missing or extra between the first and second segmentation.
* The missing and extra volume elements may be measured and optionally weighted according to their distance from the reference (i.e. "correct") volume elements to produce an output indicating the quality of the one segmentation with respect to the other.
* The system may also be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
* The system provides an apparatus for automatically assessing radiation therapy segmentations, using an electronic computer executing a stored program to receive a first and second electronic file each providing data points describing different three-dimensional surfaces circumscribing a structure in a human patient intended for radiation therapy.
* The system allows users to select a metric method to evaluate the segmentations, which may be a combination of a constant value, a linear function of a number of error volume elements with distance, and an exponential function of the number of error volume elements with distance.
* The system displays a histogram showing cumulative missing volume elements as a function of distance ranges and cumulative extra volume elements as the function of distance ranges.
* The system may be used in the training of clinicians, periodic quality assurance testing of anatomy auto-segmentation routines and systems, and assessment of anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems prior to customer purchase or clinical application.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for accelerating the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit, which is a complex operation requiring a greater time period than standard data format operations.
* The effective subtraction operation involves aligning fractions, subtracting, and normalizing the result, which can be time-consuming.
* The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument, which is used to begin the subtraction of differences between operand fractions.
* The subset difference is used to determine the correct final fraction result, which is available when the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is determined.
* The invention uses a technique to accelerate the computation of the final fraction result, which involves calculating a difference between the seven least significant bit signals of the operand exponent argument.
* The apparatus implementing the invention includes a detection and logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, a subtraction unit, and a selection logic unit, which work together to determine the correct final fraction result.
* The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by initiating the calculation of the final fraction result prior to the determination of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments, thereby reducing the time required for the operation.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention aims to reduce mislabeling of specimen vials in medical facilities by using a system that tracks specimens with unique machine-readable codes.
• The system includes a computer storage, a standalone or networked computer, and an electronic reading means, such as a barcode scanner.
• The method involves storing patient, order, and specimen-taker information in the computer storage, along with unique machine-readable codes for each specimen container.
• The system generates a signal to acquire a specimen from a patient and places the acquired specimen in a container, and stores an indication of this in the computer storage.
• The system also checks if the specimen container is out-of-date and generates an alert signal if it is.
• The system can track multiple specimens and store their information in a relational manner in the computer storage.
• The invention provides a failsafe, zero-defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples, eliminating the need for vial labels and associated printers and staff labor.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide golfers with distance and other information on a golf course.
• The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and uses commercially available GPS data to measure distance and other factors.
• The device incorporates voice recognition technology to accept voice commands from the user, which are sensed by a voice sensor, such as a bone conductance vibration sensor or a microphone.
• The device responds to voice commands and provides an audible output by electronically produced spoken words, to provide distance and other information to the user via a loudspeaker or headphone.
• The device can also be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be expanded to include its use in any portable application.
• The device can be connected to a separate personal computer or similar technology via a serial, USB, or wireless connection to facilitate various detailed functions, such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports errors for different regions in a system that includes logic and memory circuits.
* The conventional methods of checking design rules for systems-on-chip (SOC) designs have several disadvantages, including the need for manual checking and the possibility of false errors.
* The present invention provides a system and method that applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data, eliminating false errors and expediting the implementation of circuit designs into silicon form.
* The system includes a standard logic design rule and customized logic rules for different types of areas, such as specialized memory areas.
* The customized design rules are created by modifying the standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular regions in the chip, and are based on pushing more liberal parameters onto stricter parameters contained in the standard logic rules.
* The system checks different regions with different design rules, and the results consist of only real logic and real memory errors.
* The present invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks, and can be extended to include other design rules for other areas that have differing design rule requirements.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention described in the source document is a waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator that uses a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, to provide controlled illumination of objects.
• The WGH illuminator has several advantages over conventional illumination systems, including a compact and rugged design, reduced reflection losses, and high diffraction efficiency.
• However, the WGH illuminator also has some limitations, including alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, and the production of two diffracted beams.
• To combat these limitations, various solutions have been proposed, including attaching the source firmly to the edge of the waveguide, using a spatially and spectrally broad source, and compensating for illumination depletion using a photographic emulsion or a priori recording of the hologram.
• The WGH illuminator has been successfully used to illuminate spatial light modulators (SLMs) and display holograms, and has been shown to produce high-quality reconstructed beams with minimal depolarization and phase distortion.
• The invention has been disclosed with reference to generic descriptions and specific embodiments, and is intended to be broadly applicable to various light sources, objects for illumination, and other applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to obtain the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor.
* The apparatus includes a test head with exciting means for magnetizing the rotor, voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal, current sensing means for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current, and processing means for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor.
* The apparatus also includes skew sensing means for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor and generating an effective skew signal, and a data acquisition and processing system that controls the acquisition of test data, processes the data, and produces useful test results and rotor pass/fail determinations.
* The system uses a dual fixture design, allowing for simultaneous testing of two rotors, and includes a control processor that controls the sequence of events during a test, including the activation of the retraction and drive mechanism, the rotation of the rotor, and the sampling of the voltage, current, and skew signals.
</summary>

<summary>

* The computing power of mobile devices is increasing, allowing for more sophisticated applications to be developed, but also increasing the risk of attackers obtaining digital rights management keys or device keys. To mitigate this risk, a provider may want to protect the device by only allowing certain types of hardware and proprietary closed-source software.
* A provider may want to allow third parties to develop applications for the device, but still maintain control over how third-party code is treated by the device. This can be achieved by providing a sandbox that verifies third-party code at runtime or by configuring the operating system to segregate third-party code from kernel-mode code.
* An embodiment of the present disclosure provides a method that includes granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library, and denying access to native resources of the operating system to a managed application.
* The method can be implemented using a manager that receives a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizes the request by checking the managed library's digital certificate, and sends a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host.
* The runtime host can be effectuated by native instructions and can access the native system resource, while the managed library can be dynamically loaded at runtime and can be operable to access any native resource. The manager can be configured to deny a managed application's request to access native resources and restrict access to only a few select managed libraries.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card containing an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* The identification card has a unique structure that protects the IC chip and antenna from damage, using two relatively shock-absorbing layers and two rigid outer laminate layers to disseminate external forces over a broad area.
* The card is made by pre-shrinking a core layer, printing fixed indicia and alkyd resin spids on one side, attaching an antenna and IC chip, and then laminating the core layer with a bottom layer and two polymer layers, which can be personalized with inkjet printing or dye diffusion thermal transfer methods.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a FIFO-type queue, in a functional memory environment.
* In a functional memory, updates are made by copying the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating and then making the update in the copied data.
* The traditional way of implementing a FIFO queue is ineffective in functional memories, as each update would result in copying the entire queue.
* The invention provides a novel way of establishing a queue using a tree-shaped structure, where additions and deletions are directed to the first non-full node or leaf node on the edge of the tree.
* The tree-shaped data structure is maintained by adding new nodes to keep the leaf nodes at the same hierarchy level.
* Each update in the functional environment requires a time and space that are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
* The node to be updated is easy to access, as the search proceeds by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found.
* A preferred embodiment of the invention includes a separate header node that comprises three elements, each of which may be empty or contain a pointer.
* The header node makes it possible to add and delete records from the beginning and end of the queue, and the queue can be inverted in constant time and space.
* The invention can be used as a double-ended queue, where additions can be made to the beginning and deletions can be made from the end of the queue.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, and more particularly to embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies. The invention provides practical methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, and one objective of the present invention is to provide EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies.
* The invention includes two types of EPROM devices: one uses DRAM storage capacitors as the coupling capacitors of EPROM memory cells, and the other uses the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data, which is called "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices. The SEPROM devices have the advantages of being manufactured by any IC technologies, ideal for embedded applications, and each data point is memorized by one transistor, making it possible to store large number of data at very low cost.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control, which permits determining the proper value of feedback gain both easily and accurately, in a short period of time and irrespective of the kind of the subject of control.

• The method of determining feedback gain according to the invention comprises a first step of provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, a second step of executing feedback control by using the provisionally determined feedback gain, and a third step of detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step.

• Evaluation values are introduced about the individual P, I and D gains for accurately evaluating the influence of the value of each gain on the voltage curve ε(t), and functions LR, Svv and Asv are introduced as evaluation functions for the P, I and D gains, respectively.

• The function LR represents the ratio between the length of the voltage curve ε(t) drawn in a measurement time and the measurement time, and the optimum value of the P gain can be obtained by controlling the P gain such that the function LR approaches the ideal value of unity.

• The function Svv represents the product per 30 seconds of the summation of the measured voltage Vi in the measured time and constant C, and the optimum value of the I gain is obtained by controlling the I gain such that Svv approaches zero.

• The function Asv represents the product per 30 seconds of the summation of the absolute value of the measured voltage Vi in the measured time and constant C, and the optimum value of the D gain can be obtained by controlling the D gain such that Asv approaches zero.

• The optimum values of the P, I and D gains are determined by executing a process of obtaining the optimum value of the P gain, a process of obtaining the optimum value of the I gain, and a process of obtaining the optimum value of the D gain in succession, and the optimum value data of the three different gains are registered together with the course condition data as a set of data in the RAM of the central processor.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention aims to create a zoom lens with a high relative aperture, a high zoom ratio, and a standard image angle at the wide-angle end, while minimizing the size of the entire lens system and preserving high-grade optical performance throughout the zooming range.
• The zoom lens consists of five lens units: a first unit for focusing, a second unit for varying image magnification, a third unit for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth unit for making the diverging light beam almost parallel, and a fifth unit for image formation.
• The lens design is constrained by four conditions: (1) the refracting power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth unit, (2) the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth unit to the whole fifth unit, (3) the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth unit, and (4) the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth unit.
• Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided, each with a total length of approximately 9.13φA to 9.19φA, demonstrating the feasibility of the invention in achieving a large relative aperture, high range zoom lens of reduced size while preserving high-grade optical performance.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like, which enables both the detection of individual particles and the integration of count rates without knowing in advance the expected count or signal rates.
* The method involves discharging a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side, which simplifies the distinction of small-size signals and prevents leakage current in high-voltage cables.
* The invention proposes a device that includes a detector, a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals, which are connected to a support capacitor for rapid compensation of the detector discharge.
* The device also includes a low-pass element or a high-pass element preceding the amplifiers to separate signals as a function of the rate, allowing for the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals in overlapping ranges.
* The invention enables the detection of uncharged particles by doping or coating the detector material with a converter material, which generates electric pulses when an uncharged particle passes through the detector.
* The device can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and medical technology, for detecting and integrating individual particles or signals.
* The invention provides a reliable and simple separation of signals during detection, allowing for the measurement of individual particles and the integration of signals in different measuring ranges.
* The device can be optimized for read-out performance by adapting the wave resistance of the detector to the input impedance of a preamplifier and a 50-ohm-cable, if provided.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly, which is used in friction clutches to selectively connect a source of rotational power to a driven mechanism.

• The prior test fixture for spin checking the driven disc assembly was slow and inefficient, requiring several manual operations and generating no external indication of whether the tested assembly was good or bad.

• The improved apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and a control system with a microprocessor.

• The control system includes inputs from an optical encoder, a position sensor, and a sensor portion of the servo motor, as well as manually operable control switches.

• The microprocessor controls the operation of the torque motor and the servo motor, and generates signals to a display to provide a visual indication of the status of the apparatus.

• The program executed by the microprocessor includes instructions to read the signals from the control switches, actuate the servo motor to move the movable ring toward the stationary ring, and measure the distance separating the two rings.

• The program also includes instructions to actuate the torque motor to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, and to measure the distance separating the two rings after the torque motor has been actuated.

• The difference between the two distances is compared with a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.

• The apparatus automatically determines whether the assembly is within specified tolerances and generates external indications to the operator of the condition of the tested assembly, minimizing the chances of operator error.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor, particularly in the field of image processing.

• Face recognition is a challenging task due to large variations in human faces, and face age-estimation is even more difficult.

• The invention aims to provide an accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solution to the problem of face age-estimation.

• The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images.

• The CAM algorithm combines a modified active shape model (MASM) and a quasi-localized texture model to represent the facial structure and texture.

• The invention uses a statistical principal component analysis (PCA) model to build a linear model for the extracted appearances.

• The invention uses support vector regression (SVR) to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions: a growth and development mapping function and an adult aging mapping function.

• The invention uses support vector machines (SVMs) to build an age classifier that can distinguish between youths and adults.

• The invention uses the CAM algorithm to extract feature vectors from the first image data, and then uses the age classifier and aging functions to estimate the age of the individual represented by the first image data.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images with different definitions, which preserves the definition of the image with the higher definition.
• The matrix display device comprises a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels, where each arrangement can be formed by a square of four pixels.
• In one embodiment, three pixels of each arrangement are dedicated to display the first image and receive light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the first image, while the remaining pixel is dedicated to display the second image and receives a light intensity signal associated with the pixel of the second image.
• The controller can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the first image to correct the display of the first image and enhance the visibility of the second image.
• The matrix display device can be configured to display a first image, such as a monochrome image from a night vision sensor, merged with a second image, such as a graphical image or a monochrome image from an infrared sensor.
• The invention can be applied to various applications, including the display of a first image and a second image, a first image and a third image, or a plurality of combined images with different definitions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system, which has a housing with electronics and a communication means that can be brought into communication with a communication means of the security system located on board the motor vehicle.
• The mobile identification transmitter has a payment element that can be removed from the housing and used for payment actions, such as at a gas station or shopping center, and can be brought into data communication with an electronic payment system.
• The payment element can have a microprocessor, storage device, and credit card or debit card function, and can be used for remote financial transactions, such as loading or debiting a defined amount.
• The mobile identification transmitter has a secure state in which the payment element is removed from the receptacle of the housing, and a closure protects the contact elements from the external environment, preventing function disruptions and unauthorized payment actions.
• The closure can be designed as a dummy plug, a cap that pivots or moves translationally, and can be used to seal off the contact elements and electronics in the receptacle, and can also serve as an advertisement or information board.
</summary>

<summary>

• The imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, becomes inactive when not in use and is often put into a "sleep mode" to save energy. When the device "wakes up," it starts warming up and performs imaging operations with toner.

• The toner used in the imaging device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, and a toner concentration (TC) sensor measures the concentration of the toner in the developer by detecting the tribo charge.

• If the imaging device is inactive for a long period of time, the tribo charge of the toner may decrease, affecting the image quality in an imaging operation.

• The exemplary embodiments address these issues by determining one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.

• The inactivity determining section determines the activity and inactivity of the machine, and the relationship between the inactivity time and the tribo charge of the toner is approximated by a power law.

• The user usage pattern determining section determines a usage pattern of the user, and the predicting section predicts the next user usage from the determination made by the inactivity determining section.

• The measuring section measures the TC sensor level at various times during the usage of the machine, and the calculating section calculates a decay of the tribo charge of the toner based on the difference between any two sensor levels.

• The disclosed methods may be readily implemented in software or hardware using standard logic circuits or a VLSI design, and variations of the above-disclosed and other features and functions may be desirably combined into many other different systems or applications.

• The intelligent toner charging system may be used in a xerographic machine, and the toner may be charged based on the calculated decay to ensure that the developer is at an adequate charge level for normal printing.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that permits independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure.
• The apparatus includes a control signal generator on the stationary drum side and a decoder circuit on the rotary drum side, which discriminates data of the control signals and controls the operating currents of the MR heads in response to the output signals of the decoder circuit.
• The invention enables the bias currents for the MR heads to be controlled with a one-channel control signal sent from the stationary drum side, and the MR heads can operate at their respective optimal points, resulting in stable data recording and reproduction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improving the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
* The prior art uses a passive technique employing a gradiometer or a magnetic locator for detecting ferrous metal objects, and an active technique using a transmitter to induce alternating currents in non-ferrous metal pipes or cables.
* The invention employs a transmitter with a pair of antennae that generate corresponding magnetic fields, inducing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses the magnetic fields and produces an output signal dependent on the sensing of both fields.
* The system of the invention is capable of producing two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, allowing for easier and more accurate location and tracing of one cable in the presence of an adjacent cable.
* The invention uses various techniques to make the currents distinguishable, such as using different carrier frequencies, amplitude-modulating the currents with different frequencies, or pulsing the currents at different repetition rates.
* The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced, and the effect achieved by the invention is enhanced by the fact that the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between the antennae and the cable.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
